metadata.name: Affects
metadata.description:
There is nothing more human than the ability to affect and be affected. With this piece, I searched to convey profound emotions, links, touches and affects between women with AI.

The relationships are enigmatic and ambiguous: sometimes they seem lovers, other times mothers and daughters, sisters or friends. But the affects are undoubtedly there. 

Piece made for the DEEP FAKE exhibition at Superchief, curated by Clownvamp.

Music: Bach - Book I: Prelude and Fugue No. 8 in E Flat Minor, BWV 853, Prelude by Carlos Gardels (CC0 1.0)

BIO
Kika Nicolela is a Brazilian artist, filmmaker and curator based in Brussels. Graduated in Film Studies by the University of Sao Paulo, Nicolela has also completed a Master of Fine Arts at the Zurich University of the Arts. Kika Nicolela has participated of hundreds of solo and group exhibitions at art institutions worldwide for the past 20 years.  She is represented by the Galerie Charlot (Paris/Tel Aviv) and Area35 (Milan).
